column4: hey guys I'm trying to follow instructions on this page but the sudo mv command won't work, the error I get is mv: cannot stat /homebigiron//xxx no such file or directory but the file is there
http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=539423&highlight=how+to+manually+install+Java
errr /home/bigiron
I'm trying to move the java 6u6 JRE runtime from my home folder to the /usr/lib/jvm
I even tried to do it via the GUI, and I get a permission denied so... this is really starting to not work out very well
I really wish I could just copy/move as I please in GUI
are you trying to move a folder?
are you using a GUI based file manager>?
I guess? I'm using places>computer>filesystem>folder
press alt+f2
type in gksu nautilus
and key in your password, and move to the location of /bin
nautlius can explore your files and folders on the hdd
You do have the privilages
It was just that you had not passed the privileges to the application you were running
make sure you put sudo before that
that would give the rights necessaryu
yeah I had to do sudo to make the folder to begin with
you only need to gksu nautlius if you are essentially moving "system files"
cool... I could have thought of that
did you try to winetrick .net packages?
